results.title: Another day
results.creator_credit: Anti Cancer Council, Jennie Blackwood and Zanthus Films
results.brief_description: Views of a number of people who have suffered from cancer leading normal happy lives. Stresses the importance of seeking medical advice and aid at the first suspicion that one has contracted the disease.

results.title: Angkor, the lost city
results.brief_description: Angkor - a whole metropolis of palaces and temples recovered from the jungle which hid them for centuries until discovered in 1860 by a French naturalist. Monuments, picture tapestries in stone and Angkor Vat, a mile square temple of grey sandstone which no other church has rivalled in size, reveal the glories of the past empire of the Khmers, ancestors of the Cambodians.
results.description: Angkor - a whole metropolis of palaces and temples recovered from the jungle which hid them for centuries until discovered in 1860 by a French naturalist. results.title: Adam and Eve
results.brief_description: An animated film using abstract cutouts, symbolising life, reproduction, growth and destruction from creation to the end of the world in an explosion, then the beginning of a new cycle.

results.title: Aboriginal canoe trees of the Murray
results.creator_credit: Australian Institute of Aboriginal and Torres Strait Islander Studies, South Australian Museum and Robert Edwards
results.brief_description: Aborigines of the lower Murray River formerly made large canoes from the bark of Red Gum trees. This film documents the felling of a canoe tree from the sides of the Murray and its transportation to the South Australian Museum for preservation.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Australian Institute of Aboriginal and Torres Strait Islander Studies, South Australian Museum and Robert Edwards

results.title: Abakanowicz in Australia
results.creator_credit: Malcolm Otton, Christopher McGill, Crafts Council of Australia and Film Australia
results.brief_description: Polish artist Magdalena Abakanowicz prepares for an exhibition of her work in Australia. We see her exhibits of large rope, hessian and string three-dimensional forms. She comments upon her intended purpose in working with such materials. Narrated by Margaret Throsby.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Malcolm Otton, Christopher McGill, Crafts Council of Australia and Film Australia

results.title: Ride
results.creator_credit: ACMI Digital Storytelling, Matthew Hunt and ACMI
results.brief_description: Matt Hunt talks candidly about his all-consuming addiction: riding bikes. It is an obsession that has changed the way he looks at the world, cost him physically and financially but one that he is not likely to give up soon.
results.creator_credit_for_label: ACMI Digital Storytelling, Matthew Hunt and ACMI

results.title: On a Sunday he went fishing
results.creator_credit: ACMI Digital Storytelling, Sarah Mifsud and ACMI
results.brief_description: Sarah Mifsud’s father was an avid fisherman as was his father before him. Mifsud tells of the ordinary Sunday which turned tragically extraordinary for her family and the journey to rebuild in the aftermath.
results.creator_credit_for_label: ACMI Digital Storytelling, Sarah Mifsud and ACMI

results.title: A Change of Pace
results.brief_description:
A film about the 1983 Australian Lawn Bowls Championship in Adelaide between Jeff Bradley and Jack Christey. Follows the lives of the players both at home and on the greens in the lead-up to the match.

The film begins and concludes with a promotion of the retirement services offered by the ANZ Bank.

results.title: Aluminium from Mine to Metal
results.brief_description: Gives an overview of Alcoa’s main operations in Australia including the refining of bauxite to alumina in West Australia and the extraction of aluminium at Point Henry, Victoria.
